decision_conditions: This consent shall be for a temporary period of 5 years beginning with the date on this Decision Notice. At the expiration of 5 years any use shall cease and the building shall be removed from the site. The site shall be restored in accordance with a restoration/landscape plan which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority 3 months before the expiration of the permission.Reason: The proposed building would not make full use of this site, which it is anticipated would be developed as part of a comprehensive development within the North Kingston Development Brief area in accordance with Council policies CS8 (Character, Design and Heritage) and DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to use of the building, the existing vehicle access to the site will be stopped up with the existing crossover reinstated and prevented from beneficial use, in accordance with the details set out in drawing U065/02/001/006 Rev A (Proposed Landscape Plan) approved as part of planning permission 19/02199/FUL and the measures shall be permanently retained to prevent the access for vehicles from the public highway onto the site.Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM09 (Managing Vehicle Use for New Development) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the hard and soft landscaping details approved as part of application 20/00907/CLC approved on 09/07/2020 prior to use of the building, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be maintained for that purpose only until the expiration of this permission.  Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season.Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policies DM6 (Biodiversity) and DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
description: Application under Section 73A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 1 (Approved Plans) and Condition 2 (Period of Consent) of Planning Permission ref: 19/02199/FUL (Change of use from existing Sales and Marketing Suite (Sui Generis) serving the adjacent Queenshurst development to flexible commercial floorspace (A1/A2/B1/D1)) dated 03/04/2020. Changes sought to extend the time period for the planning permission to 2026 and for the omission of 2no. parking spaces on site.
